description: Doesn't work on Fedora 36 message "unable to initialize GLEW"
This is an amazing game, one that you can easily pass the time with. Very moddable and very enjoyable. Works flawlessly on a wide range of systems.

It's a classic space trading game with a realtime 2D system map where asteroids can be mined and pirates will try to blow you up. The game has an addictive quality where you queue up some missions within a few jumps of each other, drop off your mission cargo/passengers and buy and sell some cargo along the way, only to find yourself continuing to pick up some more missions and setting up the next "run" as your cash keeps accumulating and you can think about buying that next ship. Anyone who enjoyed the Escape Velocity games will feel right at home with this.

In Endless Sky you are given a small ship and set free in a large, beautiful, living universe. It's up to you whether you make your way as a pirate, trader, rebel, military officer, bounty hunter, ... Endless Sky has the content and production values of a completed commercial game. It's a shame to call this an Escape Velocity clone. Endless Sky has more content, a better interface, and certainly superior graphics. One of the best open source games.
summary: One of the best open source games

Much like the old game from Origin, Privateer, the gameplay is in some ways more simple, and in other ways a LOT more complex... the flight is 2D, but still requires a lot of attention, but the trading, missions, upgrades and storyline is complex enough to consume a player for hours, days, even weeks at a time. There's so much to explore and play with, from the mindlessly simple to the frustrating hard, it's all too easy to let Endless Sky take over your life... at least for a little while.

description: This game has a way of never letting you stop. Every time you land and think "Ok, i finished this mission, now time to do productive things" then you see a new mission. "Oh maybe one more then i'll stop" And so on. 6/5 great game full of entertainment and time wasting.

As far as graphics go - this is not like your typical EVE or CoD Warzone with all the fancy effects and "All three dimensions" but you don't need any of that at all - I was playing this game years ago and now that I found it again I just wanted to say that it's brilliant - both this game and the devs effort.

Thank you for giving me all that joy 'back in the day'!

P.S.: And I'm afraid if I launch and start playing the game again I'll get hooked up and stop worrying about my work... so I'm not playing this and I don't know what this game looks and feels right now but I tried to review what it was 2-3 maybe even 4 years ago.

Spent a few hours and I'm already hooked. Each world you visit has its own flavor, especially great for those who enjoy being immersed in the story. Otherwise one can enjoy blazing through the game, trying to earn a profit. I recommend familiarizing oneself with the controls. 

A great game, overall.

Just like when I was a kid, but now I can write and implement my own stories. And with an active community it just keeps getting better!

Endless Sky is a great mix of trading/action with a huge world and many, many more or less interesting quests. It is very satisfying to run a calibrated fleet with 50+ ships, because you have to work pretty hard to get it.

However, the fun is shadowed by the confusing and complicated interface, a lot of micro management (like saving ships that ran out of gas between systems), tedious management of cargo between ships and equipment that can't be bought because there is no quests for it (yet). There is no explanation of how the interface work either.

If you like spending your precious spare time on googling answers that could have been a simple in-game-tutorial, you will have lot's of fun with Endless Sky.

With that being said, when you understand the mechanics and ignore all the quirks and interface issues, the game is great fun, and it have lot's of potential!

its a very interesting and interactive game, the choices you make while playing make a great deal to the outcome.

description: was soll man da machen?

Das Game spielt sich 2D. Mit den Pfeiltasten kann man das Schiff beschleunigen (Pfeil oben) oder lenken (Pfeil links/rechts) - um zu bremsen, muss man das Raumschiff rumdrehen und gas geben. Wenn Pfeil runter drückt, dreht sich das Schiff automatisch herum. 
Mit [M] kann man die Karte öffnen. Klick man ein _verbundenes_ Sternensystem an und schließt die Karte, kann man mit [J] dorthin "springen" (Jump). Mit [L] kann man auf den Planeten im Sternensytem landen. Auf den Planeten kann man Waren handeln oder Missionen annehmen. Außerdem kann man auf vielen Planeten auch neue Ausrüstung für sein Raumschiff oder neue Raumschiffe erwerben. 
Das ganze erninnert mich stark an Escape Velocity (ein Macintosh Spiel aus den 90ern) , da die Bedienung und die Tastenbelegung praktisch gleich ist Von dem Game habe ich mir immer eine moderne Version gewünscht.

viel Story, erstaunlich gut für ein freies Spiel. Mischung aus 2D-Kampf (Asteroids) und Strategie-nimm-Missionen-an-und-baue-deine-Schiff-zu-einer-Flotte-aus. Gibt sogar viele Erweiterungen auf der Internetseite.

Una evolución del tradicional Asteroids que añade un componente de comercio insterestelar que recuerda a juegos como el Wing Commander: Privateer, o el Freelancer, siendo posible dedicarse al comercio (bien por libre o con misiones), a la pirateria, o a cazar piratas (con misiones).
Existe también al parecer, la posibilidad de dedicarse a la minería de asteroides, aunque eso no lo he probado.
Lo único que no me gusta es que cuando te matan, estás muerto... no hay posible respawn a un momento anterior, ni nada parecido...
Aunque este ingles es buen juego de exploracion y con un mundo muy grande

description: désinstallation

Un jeu très agréable dont le développement est en pause. Très simple à jouer. Une interface superbe avec beaucoup de travail sur les icônes. Un très bon clone de Escape Velocity pour ceux qui connaissent.
j'entrave que dalle

on se ballade dans l'espace, on transporte du matos pour les uns et les autres.

seul hic, la dette de départ est très très dure à s'en défaire. et s'il y a des jours où on ne la paie pas, elle grossit. ma 1ère partie ? la dette était de 480k elle a fini à 890k avant que je supprime la partie.
différents niveaux de difficulté seraient un gros plus pour ce jeu.
mais le jeu n'a pas de bugs que j'aurais remarqué.
parfois, les explications sont un peu compliquées. mais les histoires sont bien faites.

NB: contrairement à ce qui est indiqué ce jeux est libre.

Ce jeux associe un coté aventure, un coté construction (de vaisseaux spatiaux) et un petit coté gestion de ressources. J'aime beaucoup.
